author: fellx27
title: Russian tech blog/Русский техноблог
description: There are some channels on Youtube with translations of English videos to Russian. But there is a lack of native content.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has an idea about what is to be done but it needs more rephrasing to make the proposal viable at least in theory.

The solution presents only the launching stage of the Video channel but it is recommended that the proposer should take into consideration the necessary resources to maintain it.
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget is not broken down into identifiable items. It is recommended to give details for all the resources to be used (i.e. professional recording camera - $1.000, 1 licence for video processing SW - $100, video accessories - $300 etc.).

KPIs/metrics should be defined to measure the success of the implemented project (who is the target audience and what is the level of their knowledge blockchain related? what topics are to be presented? how many users are expected to watch the content? how many materials will be delivered and at what pace? etc.)

The proposer should present a realistic timetable to complete the work. (what is to be achieved in a predefined time frame?)

The proposer should provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows what is being done and how.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal itself reads very poorly. It reads like a concept more than an executable proposal. It needs more editing so that it can be assessed properly given its direction. 

Perhaps reworking it and submitting it at the later stages will work. Unfortunately there is nothing to assess at this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer identifies the problem of the lack of Russian content on Cardano. The proposal offers the solution of creating a native Russian YouTube channel about Cardano. The proposer does not present key metrics to monitor the proposal's success. For a better evaluation it would be important to provide the proposal's key metrics and goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not present evidence of his experience and skills so it is not possible to assess whether he will be able to implement the proposal successfully. The budget was not detailed so it is not possible to assess whether the requested budget is adequate. The proposal does not present a conductible plan for implementing the proposal. The proposal does not appear to pose risks for its implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal did not present key metrics or a roadmap with milestones. There was also no deadline for implementing the proposal. Without this information, it is not possible to assess whether the proposal will be successfully implemented or how to monitor its success.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Turning Cardano and blockchain knowledge into multilingual documents is a great thing, especially Russian. Because to my knowledge, Russians usually don't use English much. Therefore, with a channel to share knowledge and information about Cardano in Russian is a solution that has a great impact on the community of people who speak Russian but do not know English.
But I still have not seen the proposer give the information or knowledge that the proposal wants to bring to the community. What is the information and knowledge? Information about projects or the background knowledge of blockchain?
Which channel does the proposal want to implement? Youtube, Facebook, Twitter,.....?
How many people will these videos reach? What is the plan to make the videos? How many videos are produced 1 week, 1 month?
There are many issues that the proposer needs to clarify in order to demonstrate to CAs the real impact of the proposal on the community."
f6_assessments.q1:
"Proposer claims that he has experienced 4 years of development for Cardano Ecosystem, Computer Science and Digital Security degree. But I don't see any proof that the above statements are true. But in the community of more than 1,400 people interested in Cardano who are using Russian, the proposer is someone with a very good reputation.
I have yet to see a specific plan for the proposer to implement this proposal. What is the content of these videos?
To demonstrate the feasibility of the proposal, I think the proposer should make a few videos to include in the proposal so that CAs can see if the proposal's ability and knowledge is enough to implement this proposal.
Maybe the proposer will explain that he needs to be funded first to buy some stuff like a good camera, voice recorder and lighting setup, so there is no video included in the proposal. But with the experience of someone who has also made shared videos. I think it is not necessary to have too complicated things to make a video. Proposer only needs a phone with recording or taking features to make a video. We don't need it to be perfect, we just need to go through a few videos to confirm the feasibility of this proposal."
f6_assessments.q2:
"Proposer stated that he wanted a $5,000 fund to buy some stuff like a good camera, voice recorder and lighting setup. But it did not give specific information about the price of each device. Besides, the proposal does not have key metrics, roadmap, goal of how many videos a week, a month. Proposer also did not specify which channels the videos made would be posted on. Youtube, Twitter, Facebook?
Therefore, it is very difficult to calculate this proposal because we will not know after the proposer receives 5,000 to buy video recording equipment, how much and how the products will be created."

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seeks to launch a native Russian Cardano channel where the native language and English are used side by side to provide information on Cardano to the people. The challenged is addressed effectively.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has 4 years development for Cardano Ecosystem, computer science, digital security degree and speaks Russian, which can make him able to implement the proposal successfully. He mentioned some plans as using videos to reach out to the natives in the language of the natives; translate Cardano blockchain into native language for people to understand.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map is not too clear but the budget is reasonable. Auditing may ask a few questions as to the details of the budget.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer tells he will launch a native Russian Cardano chanel. The statement seems to be within the challenge. 
However, as my reading through the proposal, no more information about what the proposal plan to do.
I recommend the proposer should set a goal for the proposal, then make plan in steps to reach that goal, consider how success looks like, and explain how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
I strongly disagree the proposal is impactful.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal lacks all information for feasibility. The author requests budget $5000. 
I highly recommend the proposer should make all details clearly. For example:
Budget should be broken down for: creating Cardano Youtube videos in Russian, advertising expenses, hiring of PR specialists, etc.
Detailed plan: What is 'Russian tech blog'? How to make it ? How to maintain it? what resources are needed?...
Besides, the proposer's experience and skills need to be provided with evidences. The challenge and risk relevant to the proposal implementation need to be considered.
Because of the missing information above, I strongly disagree the proposal is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal should add important information for auditing: roadmap with milestone and time horizon, metrics/KPIs and describe solution understandable clearly.
For example: How many Cardano Youtube videos with translation of English into Russian will be produced and in what period? 
Because of the missing information above, I strongly disagree the proposal is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal poses a clear problem related to the challenge criteria, in that its solution is to launch the native Russian Cardano chanel. Its positive impact for the community is understandable, although it is not clearly specified. However, in its globality, this proposal lacks information, the KPIs are not present, even if the objective of this solution is clear, it is difficult to know in detail the success indices selected so that the community can have some guidelines to refer to
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the relevant is quite clear and its position in the community precise on many occasions. The link to his website proves this. However, is this sufficient as a confidence indicator to demonstrate the reliability of a project? The budget is not detailed, nor the implementation plan of the solution. Even if a project seems simple and evident to understand, providing all the details of its implementation seems necessary, if only to demonstrate the intention of transparency. It is not possible to know how the participant envisages the implementation of his project in time, nor are the technical aspects addressed...
f6_assessments.q2: The limited information given in this proposal does not support the auditability of this project. Even if this notion is implicit in the project itself, more details and indicators of success could have been provided so that the community would have something to hold on in order to attest to the success of its implementation. This is accentuated by the fact that there is no roadmap, and no horizon for achievement either.

f6_assessments.q0: Content in videos is always a good way to attract new comers to the community. Moreover, the need for videos content even came naturally that people in Russian Catalyst community asked him to create such content for their need, which proves the need of having more resource and support for Russian Catalyst community.
f6_assessments.q1: Basically yeah, he presents well about what he have: experience, skills, attitude. The plan is simple yet clear about what he will do and how he can do it.
f6_assessments.q2: We can easily see the results: his videos after publishing. However I'm not sure about 5000$, how many videos he will produces and what tools he will need? Plus, It would be better if he includes KPIs in the proposal to make the project more auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is effectively addressing the challenge to scale multilingual resources with the creation of a Russian Cardano blog.
f6_assessments.q1: The dev behind this proposer is an active community member in the Cardano Russian community channels. A more complete proposal plan would include a timeline, KPI, budget breakdown and definitions of success.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides a general explanation of their proposal to create a Russian blog but does not follow up with a roadmap, budget, KPI or implementation plan. The proposer should consider including these proposal artifacts for better auditability by the community.
